After a couple of gulps, I decided to check out the place.  Dark wood throughout, a jukebox that has a good selection of music, the other side has another full bar and some tables (all with wooden barrels as base).  From some posters around the joint, this place also has live music - need to check that out some other time and perhaps become a regular.

XkLK2iBsgqF6mWwDfRgqqQ.review_text:
i went to go see a cover band on saturday night and the place was packed.  the sound was off since the lead singer could barely be heard but they had a fun playlist.  i think most in the crowd were friends or acquainances of the band members but it was a pretty good looking group on the whole.  i ran into a friend i hadn't seen in the while so it made me like the place more.
  they had one bartender that seemed unaware of what her job was.  she had a look of confusion and panic so maybe the bar is usually not that busy.  then again, the other bartenders were much quicker so avoid the short blonde haired one.  also, the place was insanely hot.  i saw one  fan and that's it.

Ks9eVYblgKP1IdCksQGMvg.review_text: Maggie McGarry's is the best bar in North Beach! The bartenders are some of the best bartenders I have ever seen, especially the two girls from Belfast (LOVE THEIR ACCENTS!!). They offer free live musics, with the best bands around! Any douchebag  that thinks they should get drinks refunded because their pallet doesn't like it, is NOT mature enough to drink in bar! (How old are you 19 with a fake idea or 56 with nothing better to do?). Great bar with great service, will definitely come back for a visit when I'm back in town! Love it!

w0hA9hZPZhCdJTbJlIFXKw.review_text: As a gooner and a rabid one at that this place is the bee's knees.  Large tv's and packed with Arsenal fans for every game.  Good selection of beers and perhaps the greatest bartender in Patrick as he's completely bonkers.  He also makes irish coffees just how I like them.  Up the Arse!

4mzGeIRXTrzC85xjYqYGSw.review_text: Maggie McGarry's is the official home of the Bay Area Gooners & the San Francisco Branch of Arsenal America.

-340SwO2ilj8UWV9yeP9SA.review_text: This is a great place! Patrick one of the owners is amazing. Great hospitality, and if you want to watch real football ( The game played by feet), there is no better place in San francisco to watch English Premier League games!! They open as early as the first game which is around 4:45 AM. and even that early in the morning, Patrick greets you with a big smile. I was on a business trip in San Francisco and my hotel room was not showing the game, so after a lot of searching and inquiry, I could not find a better place. Thanks Patrick.   Joseph  A. from Los Angeles

D01KrKs9izEdoT0Eh4i4rQ.review_text: A dive bar with live music.  The place is separated into two sections, one section that has the main bar and another section with a stage, a little dance floor, and a small bar.  The setup isn't too bad but the music is definitely loud, loud enough where you have to yell at anyone you want to talk to.

E9m9adcWg9h8mRX9idm9Qw.review_text: Another stop for drinks amongst the bars that run along Grant Ave--but this one has an Irish theme and a comfortable interior. It does get pretty crowded on the weekends, however there's a large back room with high-top tables you can sit with groups. They serve Guinness, a few other beers on tap, and of course, shots of the hard stuff (including patron silver tequila, which seems to be my boyfriend's favorite drink at this particular Irish establishment.)  In attempt to jump on the Tuesday night trivia bandwagon, Maggie McG's also has a guy with a mic reading questions around 8:30pm once a week. A little pop-culture skewed and definitely easier (and less competitive) than Edinburgh's Castle trivia, but still pretty fun. Not sure how long this fad will last, but it did entice me to stay for a couple more rounds of Guinness on a Tuesday eve.

CNhhP_OSJp_-OhZerMWYlg.review_text: Great place to see a live band. The place has a good vibe and fills up quick. Decent beers on tap and the bartenders are attentive.

R4DVayqiW63jHle7AG_NXQ.review_text: Good ol' Maggie McGarry's!  This place is a load of fun, and right next to the Mojito bar, which is why I always stop in for a few drinks before I go over there Mojitos to dance my behind off. *smiles*. The place is large, and has a very good atmosphere. They're HUGE Arsenal fans there (as am I!) so that makes it better. The downside was they had NO midori when I asked for my midori sour, and I nearly had to force the bartender to give me a $1 off of the drink he did end up making me since he didn't have what I wanted. But it was nice that he did, even though he was under a bit of pressure. Hehe. There was a really cute Englishman and Aussie there that chat my friend and I up a bit, good times. Sports screens are huge, a perfect place to watch any big game imaginable! The bar itself is HUGE, often there is live music as well. A great way to spend a weekend night!

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: There is a time and place for janky dive bars.   I had 20 min to kill because I was waiting for a guy.   (side note to men:  NEVER make me wait unless you have a damn good reason or suffer my wrath)  Instead of stewing in my impatience and male loathing...I had a beer.   The bar was sticky, dark and sprinkled w/ regulars...on a Sunday afternoon.  There were three tvs showing various sports games.  No one was watching...they were all drinking.   It was eerie...I was contemplating the possible complicated lives of these men and lost the anger I had for having to wait when said guy finally showed up.

XEeFjAW4NahelwwItEGHXw.review_text: All the stars for the DJ. I went last night and he was honestly playing hit after hit. He really made a simple beer pong event fun.

ywTB3kC4J2rO9hSTXyyJJQ.review_text: Came here as the last stop for a Bachelorette Party to see the 80's cover band "Fastt Tmes in the 80's".  The energy was great and everyone in the bar seemed to be having a good time.  Even as the DD for the evening, I was having a blast!  Girls in my party commented on how the drinks were decently priced and still tasty.  I can't wait to find another excuse to come back to this bar - my new favorite in SF.

Pofs_dI0I_BUyGfIORX0gQ.review_text: So you can come in this place even if you're 12 years old. They got Looney ass people working the door... Turns out it's a drunk ass Irish homeless bum  working the door that's not even employed here. K. Service sucks. Staff sucks. Environment sucks. Don't go here, don't waste your time.

A5PqLu1bVHd3uWYJoK9gsA.review_text: Good beers on tap. Can be pretty chill on a Saturday afternoon or weekday night, or pull a big crowd for events like THE WORLD SERIES (GO GIANTS!) or during a festival. Love it. Also, great bloody marys!

iXdrlePfdaiLxzHkAh9Feg.review_text: Great place to meet friends and have a time to remember. Staff is great and the drinks are strong  I was going there from the day it opened. I moved out of the city, but always stop bye when I am in town.

KtCONIE5_XOHybzkB0iysw.review_text: Ehh, an ok bar with live entertainment. Went here on a saturday night during a north beach pub crawl. The bar was extremely crowded; it took forever to get drinks and then it was cash only. A lot of places in North Beach are cash only actually. Average crowd. 20s and 30s. Nothing spectacular. A large pub if you will. I had a vodka collins - it was super sour. Stop by if ur doing a bar crawl of the area. Stay for one drink and bounce.

TMr5z8JDuGPc0I-5WfpBMQ.review_text: This was my last stop for barhopping in the North Beach area, and it was kind of a buzz kill.  It wasn't super crowded or anything inside, but we all waited outside in a short line.  Once we got in, the bar area was so narrow that we could barely walk through without pushing people to the side.  Deeper inside, there was a stage with super hillbilly music playing, which I only recognized a few of them... probably why I didn't have a good time here.  Also, the people that were here were much older, and I didn't saw people my father's and maybe even grandfather's age here.

qHmLQQZF1GKrU6HFZqZqGA.review_text: Good chill place to grab drinks. Bartender was really cool and poured our drinks strong. Will be back if in the area!

Le081ROooqFzteWcMs1-1g.review_text: The bouncer was a long hair fellow...long flowing blonde hair. His customer service was more then exceptional; it was graceful. The ATM was out of cash and I stormed out but this bouncer calmed me down just like a new mother to a child. I called my bank to check I wasn't charged and when I walked back in the bouncer had two free drinks ready for my immediate consumption. This bar hires the right staff, they care...they give.

J7ka23aCUNK-v_yLB4AL1Q.review_text: Solid spot to grab a few drinks with your buds.  Well made Car Bombs but a bit pricey. Friendly bartenders and a comfortable crowd made me want to stay but the was making my wallet cry.  This was the fourth stop on the Pub Crawl and I couldn't wait to par the hole and move onto the next. Good thing our Marshal wanted to keep us on schedule and pressed us forward.  I would have loved there to have been live music, I would have probably stuck around.

AqBNpXElwesY8zwGXQ2xbA.review_text: I've been several times, as I don't live too far. When I do go usually its to just have a couple of beers. I tend to go early before the rowdier crowed stumbles in. its not bad..The bar tender thats on at this time is nice and the drinks are fairly cheap. The jukebox has an unlimited list of all kinds of music; however, the music I listen too isn't fancied by the locals. Its an ok bar...Nothing too special in my opinion.

vJQZ8yFNerGuRnvs9HLj4w.review_text: Love Maggies - good place to grab a beer in the afternoon and great atmosphere for football/soccer/baseball games.

P3onMWiIYufwVxHhX7BKXQ.review_text: Got separated from some friends when wandering the streets of  North Beach, instead of blowing up their mobile babysitters, I decided to post my feet up and grab a drink.  Chose to walk in to Maggie McGarry's Pub because the large open windows were refreshing, and frankly, because I have a secret obsession with everything Irish!  The special of the day was a Pomegranate Margarita, which I have to admit was pretty damn good for having been ordered in a dark dungeon-esqe pub. So damn good, I decided to order another.  It must have been a hellish night full of outrageous boisterous drunks the night before, however, for Miss Bartender. She was quite a grump being very curt with me whenever I ordered, when I paid, when I smiled, anything. I don't think I saw her smile once at me, nor anyone else. I understand that it is difficult being a bartender at times, the constant come-ons from drunkards, reeking of booze every night, crap tippers, demanding people, I get it.  But c'mon laddy, you work in an Irish pub, just take a shot of whiskey to drown your sorrows and get over it!   All in all, my drink was great, yet I know a laundry list of more friendly  Irish pubs that I would rather frequent than here. And it's over to them I go to suffocate my crummy experience with a hefty pint of Guinness.

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Kinda pricey/weak drinks, and there's a clever trick wall that opens up and reveals a stage. As in for bands to rock out.

0juzbrgcLHqobdK-OZAyiw.review_text: I happened to bump into a few friends whom I haven't seen in years so they invited me to go kick it at Maggie's for a while. I really liked their clean, red brick ambiance and thought the bartender was very pleasant and attentive. Our rounds of drinks were on point and once in a while we would take a glance at the small TVs to catch all the scores and highlights. I really enjoyed the vibe and the crowd was mostly low key and pleasant.  The disappointing part of the evening was someone who had to be escorted due to severer intoxication while another person puked outside where the nasty stench started to linger into the bar. Despite having a lot of fun reconnecting with my friends those incidentals were our cues to leave. Too bad we weren't able to stick around to check out their live music but I thought we left at a good time. The place didn't make the best first impression but I would consider going back if I'm ever in area with friends.

4nS8Evpd4GI3tdbEG_sW4Q.review_text: We found this place after a Giants game last weekend, we had a blast!!! Playing darts, drinking good beer, then out of no where a band appeared! They were kick ass! Great cover band! (Aug 16) Would definitely go back next time we're in the city. Laid back, packed with fun people! Loved it!

u6RnIJmxtcYQikmmTciYhA.review_text: Such a great experience! Great "local" atmosphere. Chill environment. The bartender, Patrick, was fantastic & so helpful. He guided/recommended several other things for us to try while in the city. #nowthatsagoodbartender. Go there. Talk to him. Enjoy a great bar & have someone take time out to teach you a thing or 5 about San Fran

jXzwG-IK0Xw0khZTPFsFxQ.review_text: I've been here a few times now, and have always had a good time! The bar tenders are attentive and friendly. The live music is off and on, but with no cover charge (at least when I went) you can't complain.  One of my favorite NB bars!

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: Yay, ho! Yay, ho! Let's score a goal! [x2] Football. European Football. uh-huh. Football. European Football. sexy. Football [x4] Yay, ho! Yay, ho! Let's score a goal!  Football  OK, just had to add the lyrics of my favorite ode to soccer by Parry Gripp, as Maggie McGarry's is one of the finest spots in town to be surrounded by ravenous futbol fans from all over the world. They open early during Arsenal matches, and if you think watching 49ers games amongst a rowdy group of sports fans is fun, you haven't seen anything until watching the sun rise here in the company of fervent soccer hooligans! It's a must.  Aside from the fun game watching, it's a pretty standard Irish bar. Nothing overly thought provoking.

TroCliPm7jduwsuwacJT4Q.review_text: Awesome venue for live music on the weekends and an authentic Irish Pub experience smack in the middle of North Beach!  Love the vibe here, and love all the bartenders and staff as well.  They all know how to pour a perfect pint of Guiness :).  Go here for a great time on the weekends, or during the week for karaoke or football (soccoer :)) games.

5hHGHTb_8mlsI3On6WiCjg.review_text: mMm Good Beer and live band! And much better ventilation than next door (Grant and Green felt like a bad sauna that night). Nice bartenders who, from what I hear, know the proper way to pour/serve Guiness (who am I to question? I just know it looked oh so good). One bar accepts plastic, other does not. Restroom wasn't scary. Parking might be a problem, but so is all of North Beach (and I walked) so all is good =)

6e0khvHCOJU1YTCx8gDfSw.review_text: Fun place to go to. Went here on a Saturday night right before Bay to Breakers. I don't recall the name of the band, but I think the only appeal to majority there (guys) was the female singer. Some of the songs weren't bad at all. Only had smithwick's so can't judge the drinks but this is a lively place to go to. Definitely a place to hang out out with a friends, but it can get noisy.

BHDBfx4mWOdtT-ug0CPc3w.review_text: Live music, GREAT bartenders, fun atmosphere, and one of my favorite places in the city! The bathroom is almost always clean which is refreshing. Plenty of seating for large groups and plenty of dance floor as well! Drinks and shots are strong and very reasonable!

IG9oulUO-tprUZOY4jfG3g.review_text: good prices on drinks.  more of a week-night place i would say though.

MhcfUz_p-aA_BXGw_9B3IQ.review_text: Absolutely terrible customer service. I have been going to this bar for years, but will no longer spend my money there after how rudely I was spoken to and treated by the staff and, worst of all, the OWNER. They seem to have forgotten that they are in the SERVICE INDUSTRY.

lM9ZDLy3Uz4BOPmyB6euWA.review_text: It was 28 dollars for four fernet shots (break it down, 7 dollars per shot).    Down the street at Columbus Cafe you can get a fernet shot for 3 dollars.  I dont expect everything to be as great as Columbus, but seriously they did not offer ANY drinks at a reasonable price.  Maggie McGarry's is just a normal pub, nothing special.  I don't know why they think they can commit highway robbery on drinks for a place that is, again, not that special.

DrWFZ8H7UjtHvbhCTSQ7Wg.review_text: Tie ups with amazing bands for live music, good drinks, great location. Could not ask for more. Great sports club for Soccer matches

OhzYAGNLxX4TWMdKuowB3g.review_text: Normal bar behavior, replete with significant tips met with hostility and mischaracterization.  Skip.

bzXcplEVo3rOb4aJNnN4Ow.review_text: I had just finished a bar crawl with  the hostel group,  and I can say without hesitation this is not a hostel friendly bar.  This bar happened to be across the street from the bar the hostel crawl ended at,  and they were not open to new patrons at all.  They treated us like shit.  Keep looking if you're looking for a bar friendly to new people.  It is not surprising at all that they have a sub 4 out of 5 review ratio.

TWcqLHYI4xRWlodtNZvoHQ.review_text: Pheobe, buttery nipples, Simon says, what more do you need?? Best bar in North Beach!

9QP8plakeuE-iGAA6QK4mQ.review_text: I've always wanted a pub to call my own, where everyone knows my name *cut the cheers music* ok so I admit, I'm a proud manchester united fan, Maggie's is the BEST spot to watch English Premier League games, even though its swamped with gunners (arsenal fans) but I love to poke fun at them, especially when they are losing (then I know they won't stick around and hog the air space) it's all in the spirit of fun. Normally Patrick works the early shift and he's a very cool guy who has a lot of great stories to tell and you can share a lot of laughs with. You get to meet the locals who come in there as well, they always have some interesting banter and welcome you to their friendly Irish Neighborhood Pub!

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: Is it really possible that I have never reviewed this place?   After dozens of trips here of there years (same doorman somehow :-) ) there is no better safe bet on a weekend night. ...or after SantaCon. ..or when everyone is back from school over a holiday .. or f#@% it, just about anytime.  They get drinks churned out quickly considering the number of patrons, and the cover bands are the stuff of legend.  if there is a cover band from the 80's or 90's here, I'm "in", no question.

h0js35x4a8MMFtEQ6BqKkw.review_text: I really like this pub-  friendly staff, lots of locals.  Good music, lots of space to move around.    Though pubs are not generally my thing, will return when in north beach  =)

TN-SMdPNdWv2gHSzGqGHzQ.review_text: Was here this past weekend to hear a 90s cover band play.  Great venue with tons of friendly people.  They don't mind jamming this place tight but everyone is friendly and not too uptight.  A great place to bring friends and move on past the conversation portion of the evening.

RZUGrWB5EiNwaXHi6ZH7fw.review_text: C'mon Arsenal! The official spot to watch The Gunners on match day with a crowd of like minded Gooners. Been here plenty of times not shouting out chants and my personal opinions of how to play a proper central midfield and have always had a good time. Pretty typical Irish pub with a typical drinking fair. They have 2 bars inside on each side of the joint and I have ever only once seen one of them closed at night. Great spot to jump off from or to stumble into during a crawl, as we did for my birthday pub golf crawl. Thanks for putting up with us singing karaoke without a machine. Cheers!

jswYyz57RKLQ_pt0qvysow.review_text: It was a stormy Saturday a few weeks ago so we decided to do what's best in SF when you can't show a tourist the sites - day drinking.   Wanted to hit a nice pub in North Beach and the only one nearby that came to mind for some reason was Grant & Green. Would you believe it was padlocked at 1pm on a Saturday? Freezing and wet, we found Maggie McGarry's next door, open and bustling with people who had the same mo as us. It all came back to me now - I had been to this place at least a few times before, back when I was much younger and the North Beach bar scene was actually a scene, but I had never been here in the daylight or even half sober.    Net/Net: While I can't remember if Maggie McGarry's is a fun bar after dark, this place is perfect if you want to throw back a few (many) pints with some friends on a Saturday afternoon-turned evening.   Pros:  - Atmosphere: Clean, bright pub with a long bar for plenty of seating. Not sure if it was the joy of escaping from the storm, but everyone (service and patrons alike), just seemed really happy to be there. Bathrooms were unusually clean, too! (true, it was still early). TVs to watch the games, a juke box, and an extra room for groups or probably live music in the evening.  - Service: Bartenders were awesome! Friendly and hilarious, quick service, great Irish accents if you like that sort of thing.   - Location: Excellent spot on Grant in North Beach. Tons of restaurants and shops nearby.   Cons: Can't think of any! Will be returning to Maggie McGarry's soon.

pEnPxArLOZlKC94iVkVFxQ.review_text: I love north beach so I try to check out the different bars.  I have been to all the bars around it but this one and my friend that I was with wanted to go.  They had a trivia night which seemed fun, but im not good at trivia so instead we drank beers at the bar and ate some cookies the bartender had.  The bartender was really nice and we talked about music all.  I mean its just another bar, nothign special but nothing bad... I would not rush back though.

cCeCQxErE9ToaQQBEVFuFA.review_text: still walking around north beach before dinner and the guys needed to try some other pubs out. it was only about 6pm, just a handful of people in here. patrick (who i think works here) was a hoot. the beer i was sipping on poppy jasper was sweet and delicious. and the drunk guy in the corner singing was quite amusing

JsVB8eE-FOhJjf5hL0nNwQ.review_text: The Saturday band (not sure if they're regular) is very talented and a lot of fun! They mix in 80s and modern hits - decent size dance floor too. The bartenders are observant and serve people in the order they've been waiting. There were a couple fights that broke out, but employees were attentive in responding and throwing them out. Small line when we arrived, but no cover - yes!

LGoRaDnAgD33hP2m0F2S5g.review_text: Gotta love this pub! Great drinks and awesome live music and even better bartenders! Ms Clair is always lively and mixes a hell of a cocktail and if your looking for a laugh see Fionnuala (don't know if I'm spelling that right but she is hilarious)!!  Grab your friends and give this place a visit, you won't regret it!

vStYOq-y-R9sWs2mCZEF7Q.review_text: Absolutely crap bar. The manager was the rudest, most unprofessional bartender I've ever had the chance to meet. I thought that it was her job to provide drinks when requested, but instead I got a serving of: 'I'm going to take your order, then ignore you. When you ask for your drink again I'm going to make it seem like the biggest inconvenience in the world and take as long as I possibly can.'

_kMxRe7x1oJ3M6Nu-BEN-w.review_text: This is definitely the best bar in North Beach not to mention one of the best Irish bars in the City.  There is a good mix of locals and visitors which always makes for interesting conversation and a nice balance of Irish and Americans.  The bartenders are so friendly and make you feel like you're part of the family. I'm always very well looked after when I'm there. I must also recommend an Irish Coffee which is made with North Beach's very own Cafe Trieste coffee (which is 1 block away on Vallejo, if you didn't know). The bar staff will even allow you to order food from the local restaurants and eat at the bar.  In the true passion of North Beach there is nothing better than the family owned businesses supporting each other. I think that Maggie's has settled into the neighborhood quite nicely.

mJH1L8vKU9p2BChGcNBaBQ.review_text: Ok, I have a slight hangover from the stiff drinks, so bear w/ me please :) LOVE this bar. Sweet no-nonsense bartender, aforementioned drinks of stiffness, flocks of cute Irish guys, clean loo! :) also karaoke on wed nites!

BZOf-RMFNcNsBnj4c17-cQ.review_text: I need to preface this review by stating:  I, a female with a preference for wearing high-heeled leather boots and a black mini-skirt, walked into the packed bar BY MYSELF on a crowed Wednesday night. I was simply waiting to meet up with gal pals at The House across the street.  I immediately proceeded to the bar and started chatting it up with a friendly gentleman. Said gentleman turned out to be the owner. I had told him it was my first time at Maggie McGarry's, so he ordered almost every item on the menu for me and I essentially was forced into drinking bottomless glasses of wine. And I was not complaining! This made me a very happy girl. SOOOO HAPPY that once my friends met up at The House, I opted to stay at Maggie McGarry's a little bit longer! Ok, a lot of  bit longer.  The kitchen manager was a doll, too. Great conversation. We teamed up to play trivia. The trivia wizard was also a sweetie-pie. They were all just so  very personable!  I eventually parted ways with my new three friends (hugs were given to all, of course) and I finally met up with the gals SUPER LATE to dinner... but I was totally fine, for I had already eaten dinner with  the Maggie McGarry's owner, kitchen manager, and trivia answer grand marshal!   Next time I make it to Maggie's, I think i'll be going alone again... just for kicks.

Q9kTp0Qlm9vCmbTwBuUyWg.review_text: Just be careful when paying by card.. for some reason my account was preauthorized twice amounting to over $200...  other than that.. staff are friendly

Ip-QVKDEjjjg5xQUwdE4rQ.review_text: Great for watching free soccer/football in the am; always a friendly  reception, even if you're not an Arsenal fan, as many attendees are... Nice pint og Guinness, of course...

d5J5E3GhDX-o534NP9Jo3w.review_text: Ok, so it is odd, Irish in an Italian hood, and they do have a bit of a sauna going on in the back by the dance floor. But all I know is that I had a cover-free blast dancing and singing with Livewire last Friday.

cpdHtPxy6O1GTURUTlZkaw.review_text: This place is great. Loved the classic rock cover band. I need to personally thank the bartender- the girl with the curly hair and glasses. She was beyond amazing and kind last night to me when I had a little too much to drink. She remembered my friend who I was there with and got her off the dance floor for me. They are truly good people who work there.

iXb6BquJQpg6Y02wEqa5Yw.review_text: Good place on Friday and Saturdays to dance to music and have a big crowd. Doorman is Jim -- nice enough guy usually but can be a jerk. Better than most bouncers.

WFz1Rtv31XJSVduwGa4TZA.review_text: Hella narrow and sweaty, but always brings promises of heavy amounts of drunken debauchery. Did I mention 80's cover band (amongst various other live bands)?  All in all your standard Irish pub, only awesome because it's not in Sacramento, so the percentage of Affliction-clad frat boys and bedazzled 21 year old girls tends to stay at a refreshingly low number. Winning!  **side note - bring cash!

EGuLB7xaTYzzIVFeq3F-2g.review_text: Came here on a random Wednesday night, when me and some friends decided to randomly go into some bar we never go to. Walking down the street, we saw that they had Kareoke night and the people singing was actually pretty good, so we decided to go in.  This bar has a great atmosphere, everybody is having fun, singing along to whatever song they have up on the screen.   They have 2 bars, so it''s pretty easy to get your drinks, unlike other bars where everybody is crowding up the bar area and takes forever to get anything.  The bartender took our order and was pretty quick in preparing our stuff. They do have Hef on tap, so that's an extra for me.  The owner (I think it's the owner, the one who checks the ID), is a pretty chill and funny guy.  Everybody here is really friendly and just looking to have a great time. So with that said, and the drinks pretty good and not too pricey, this is definitely a great bar to come kick it with some of your friends.

-40hChgdlI5clkagmyoh5g.review_text: Not bad!!  After a gruesome property midterm we came here to drown our sorrows!!  On the day we went, Sunday, they had free weiners which was perfect since I was starving and had to eat something to soak up the Trumer PilsnerS. Was surprised on how empty it was for a Sunday Football day...it's okay cuz more weiners for me.....

v_gv21JqJYv8ikelp-ksOQ.review_text: I can't help but love this place! Live music for free, Hello! They never charge cover which means more money for the drinking fund (hick-up). The bartenders are super-duper fast and friendly!  This is a must for any pub-crawl in the area, big space is a plus! They show early morning soccer games, I'm not usually a morning person but its cool to have a place to go for the die-hard soccer fans.  An Irish bar with real Irish people, now we're talking!  The hot whiskeys are amazing and so are the Irish coffees.  I'll be back soon.  Karaoke on Wednesdays is always a great fun.  Don't tell anyone who blows to come here, I want it to stay cool.

3zWYE-sXRgbT6pHzGo8LNw.review_text: i'm 27 and i think i was the oldest person in there.  the band was decent but the dance floor was filled with 21 year olds...if that old.

XnbGrJNw0wglmqXekW138Q.review_text: hope i got the name right for this place... fun new irish bar where the lost and found used to be - right next to grant and green.  i think they did a good job renovating the inside - it has a cool atmosphere and lots of tables and places to sit.  pretty good music - they have a jukebox which i think is always a plus!  its still really new but the 2 times i have been there its been pretty full.  it also kind of reminds me of the field, which was an awesome bar on union at grant which i am sorry to say closed a few years ago.  good times at that place!  hopefully this will turn out to be more of the same!  definitely check it out...

l0PYkotRgNgz4ZqAjGFzPg.review_text: Kinda pricey for drinks, even in North Beach. Effen Black Cherry and tonic and a pink of beer was $15! For a better deal and less stinky bar, head to Gino and Carlo's.

XG-JynrbKiiNaqT4ffdI_w.review_text: Not a bad addition to the neighborhood. Typically not crowded, has beer and other booze, what more do you want from a bar? Tip: Do not ask the very Irish bartender if she gets offended when people order Irish Car Bombs. (She does)

616XlyIHcXy_znH8xMkTTg.review_text: Seriously the dark headed bartender sucks. She was so rude when we tried to order our drinks. $20 minimum I get we are in sf but everywhere else is $15. And no need to be rude about. I would skip this bar and go to the ones near it.

DH7ABAMHvl6IQfJ_yK7x5Q.review_text: With the rumors of Irish bars being the new "hot thing", I was expecting this one to be as inauthentic as it gets.  At first glance, it smells new and not of the usual stale Guinness, it's clean and light, and it's got an awesome mural on the wall of legendary rock 'n' rollers.  I was pretty suspicious of it until I was pulled aside by a friend of mine who frequents my Irish bar in the Sunset.  She said it's owned by a good Irish friend of hers so I know it's legitimate.  It's pretty spacious and has the typical dark wood bar and such.  Definitely a good choice if you aren't feelin' the pretty boys of Magnet or the grunge of Grant & Green.

me12xQhNiGNnau9rHus3HQ.review_text: As a Gooner I cannot rate lower but have loved watching an Arsenal game early in the morning as well as chatting to Borussia Dortmund fans in evening. Plus great advice from locals on food...
